job_title: Athletics Marketing and Communications Assistant in Rochester, NY
pros: As a former student-athlete at Roberts, I have been welcomed with open arms and tasked to do many things. The department is small, making everyone close, but it is exciting to see things from the administrative side and learn from some great people.
cons: With a small staff comes wearing a lot of different hats. I've been tasked with many crazy tasks that I didn't think fell under my job description. But, you get a lot of great experience doing different things from gameday preparation, marketing, communications, operations, etc.

pros: As a student worker, they were very considerate of scheduling and time off
cons: If coworkers don’t do their jobs, you pick up the slack. Sometimes new protocols or rules will be put into place for seemingly no reason.

pros: All the workers are very nice, they trained me well, and I get to pick my time to match my schedule
cons: There are no cons, everything is good

pros:
Staff is very focused on the doing the right thing for the student.
Great Christian culture.

job_title: Assistant Dean of Students in Rochester, NY
pros: The small community at Roberts allows for meaningful relationships between students and staff/faculty. It is easy to stay motivated to do good work when your proximity to students and their transformation takes center stage.
cons: Very limited resources for professional development and limited resources in serving our constituents. Hyper-optimism shades us from the reality of our situation.

review_title: Very flexible and nice to work with
pros: They are very flexible and fun to work for, very friendly too.
cons: Hours varied, but not a big deal
